options.content:
## ROCm Version

**Version:** 7.2.0

*Note: ROCm version is read from `/opt/rocm/.info/version`*

panels.title: GPU Utilization
panels.description:
Current GPU graphics activity percentage.

Shows how much of the GPU's compute units are actively processing workloads. Values near 100% indicate the GPU is fully utilized.

panels.title: VRAM Usage
panels.description:
Percentage of GPU VRAM currently in use.

High values (>90%) may indicate memory pressure. Monitor this to ensure models and data fit within available VRAM.

panels.title: GPU Temperature
panels.description:
Current GPU edge temperature.

Normal operating temperatures are typically 40-80°C. Temperatures above 90°C may indicate cooling issues or excessive load.

panels.title: Power & Energy
panels.description:
Power: Current GPU power consumption.
Total Energy: Sum of power over time range (Average Power × Time Range).

Calculated as: avg_over_time(power[$__range]) × ($__range_ms / 1000)

panels.title: GPU Utilization Over Time
panels.description:
GPU graphics activity percentage over time.

Track GPU workload patterns and identify periods of high or low utilization. Useful for capacity planning and performance optimization.

panels.title: VRAM Usage Over Time
panels.description:
GPU VRAM usage percentage and absolute values over time.

Used: Currently allocated VRAM in GB.
Total: Total available VRAM in GB.

Monitor trends to detect memory leaks or plan for model loading strategies.

panels.title: GPU Temperature & Power
panels.description:
GPU temperature and power consumption over time.

Temp: Edge temperature (°C).
Junction Temp: Hotspot temperature (°C) - typically higher than edge temp.
Power: Average package power consumption (W).

Correlate temperature with power to identify thermal throttling or cooling issues.

panels.title: CPU Load (1min)
panels.description:
1-minute average CPU load.

Load represents the average number of processes waiting for CPU time. Values above the number of CPU cores indicate system overload.

panels.title: CPU Memory Usage
panels.description:
Percentage of system RAM currently in use.

High memory usage (>90%) may cause swapping and performance degradation. Monitor to ensure adequate RAM for workloads.

panels.title: Disk Reads
panels.description:
Current disk read rate.

Shows data being read from storage devices. High read rates may indicate data loading, model loading, or cache misses.

panels.title: Disk Writes
panels.description:
Current disk write rate.

Shows data being written to storage devices. High write rates may indicate logging, checkpointing, or data persistence operations.

panels.title: CPU Load & Memory
panels.description:
CPU load averages (1min, 5min, 15min) and memory usage percentage over time.

Load averages show system demand trends. Memory % shows RAM utilization. Monitor for capacity planning and performance issues.

panels.title: Disk I/O
panels.description:
Disk read and write rates over time.

Read Rate: Data read from storage (MB/s).
Write Rate: Data written to storage (MB/s).

High I/O rates may indicate heavy data processing, model loading, or logging activity.

panels.title: VRAM Bandwidth & Data Transfer
panels.description:
VRAM bandwidth utilization and cumulative data transfer over time.

Read/Write Bandwidth: Current memory bandwidth usage (GB/s).
Total Read/Write/Transfer: Cumulative data moved over the time range (GB).

High bandwidth indicates active GPU memory operations. Cumulative totals show overall data movement.

panels.title: UMC Activity
panels.description:
Unified Memory Controller (UMC) activity percentage.

UMC manages GPU memory subsystem. High activity indicates active memory operations. Monitor for memory bandwidth bottlenecks.

panels.title: VCN Activity
panels.description:
Video Core Next (VCN) activity percentage.

VCN handles video encoding/decoding. Activity indicates video processing workloads. Typically low for AI inference workloads.

panels.title: MMA Activity
panels.description:
Matrix Multiply Accelerator (MMA) activity percentage.

MMA handles matrix operations used in AI/ML workloads. High activity indicates active inference or training operations.

panels.title: GPU Activity Metrics Over Time
panels.description:
Various GPU activity metrics over time.

GFX: Graphics/compute activity.
UMC: Memory controller activity.
VCN: Video codec activity.
MMA: Matrix multiply accelerator activity.

Compare different activity types to understand GPU workload composition.

panels.title: Network Receive
panels.description:
Network receive rate over time.

Shows incoming network traffic. High rates may indicate API requests, model downloads, or data ingestion.

panels.title: Network Transmit
panels.description:
Network transmit rate over time.

Shows outgoing network traffic. High rates may indicate API responses, data exports, or streaming outputs.

panels.title: Network I/O
panels.description:
Network receive and transmit rates over time.

Receive Rate: Incoming traffic (MB/s).
Transmit Rate: Outgoing traffic (MB/s).

Monitor network activity to understand API usage patterns and bandwidth requirements.

panels.title: Lemonade Server Status
panels.description:
Whether the Lemonade server is up and responding (1 = up, 0 = down).

This metric is based on successful health checks. If this shows 0, the server may be down, unreachable, or timing out.

panels.title: Lemonade Tokens Per Second
panels.description:
Current token generation rate from the last request.

Shows how fast the server is generating tokens. Higher values indicate better performance. This is a per-request value, not an average.

panels.title: Lemonade Time to First Token
panels.description:
Time taken to generate the first token from the last request.

Lower values indicate faster response times. Includes prompt processing time. Typical values range from 0.1-2 seconds depending on model size and hardware.

panels.title: Lemonade Concurrent Users
panels.description:
Estimated number of concurrent users based on request patterns.

Calculated from requests within a sliding window. Useful for understanding server load and capacity planning.

panels.title: Lemonade Total Sessions
panels.description:
Total cumulative number of sessions processed.

Each new request increments this counter. Useful for tracking overall server usage and workload volume over time.

panels.title: Lemonade Active Requests
panels.description:
Estimated number of requests currently being processed.

Based on request timestamps and estimated durations. High values indicate the server is handling multiple concurrent requests.

panels.title: Lemonade llama.cpp Backend Throughput
panels.description:
Prompt Throughput: Average tokens per second processed during prompt phase.
Generation Throughput: Average tokens per second generated during inference.

Higher values indicate better performance. Prompt throughput is typically much higher than generation throughput.

panels.title: Lemonade llama.cpp Backend Requests
panels.description:
Processing: Number of requests currently being processed by the backend.
Deferred: Number of requests waiting in queue (deferred due to capacity limits).

High deferred counts indicate the backend is at capacity. Monitor this to detect when additional backends or resources are needed.

panels.title: Lemonade llama.cpp Generation Load Factor
panels.description:
Generation load factor: ratio of generation time to wall clock time.

Values range from 0.0 to 1.0+:
- 0.0-0.5: Low load (generation time < 50% of wall clock)
- 0.5-1.0: Moderate to high load
- 1.0+: Very high load (multiple concurrent requests)

Calculated as: increase(generation_time_total[5m]) / 300 - shows generation seconds per wall clock second over 5-minute window.

panels.title: Lemonade Models Loaded
panels.description:
Number of models currently loaded in memory.

Shows how many models are available for inference. Monitor to ensure models are loaded correctly and track memory usage.

panels.title: Lemonade Last Request Tokens
panels.description:
Token counts from the most recent request over time.

Input: Tokens in the user's prompt.
Output: Tokens generated by the model.
Prompt: Total prompt tokens (may include cached tokens).

Useful for understanding request patterns and token usage.

panels.title: Lemonade Performance Metrics
panels.description:
Key performance metrics over time.

Tokens/sec: Generation rate from last request.
Time to First Token: Latency to first token.
Output Rate: Average output token rate over 5 minutes.

Monitor these to track server performance and identify bottlenecks.

panels.title: Lemonade Token Decode Time Histogram
panels.description:
Distribution of token decode times.

Shows how long it takes to decode each token. Heatmap visualization with time buckets on Y-axis and time ranges on X-axis. Lower decode times indicate better performance.

panels.title: Lemonade Cache Hit Rate
panels.description:
KV cache hit rate from the last request (0.0-1.0).

Shows what fraction of prompt tokens were served from cache vs processed fresh. Higher values indicate better cache effectiveness, leading to faster responses and lower compute costs.

- >0.8: Excellent cache performance
- 0.5-0.8: Good cache performance
- <0.5: Poor cache performance - investigate cache configuration

panels.title: Lemonade Backend Decode Call Rate
panels.description:
Rate of llama_decode() calls per second for each backend model.

Shows backend activity level and generation frequency. Higher rates indicate more active token generation. Useful for comparing model utilization and identifying which models are handling the most requests.

panels.title: Lemonade Token Processing Rates
panels.description:
Overall token processing rates across all requests.

Input Rate: Average input tokens per second (prompt processing).
Output Rate: Average output tokens per second (generation).

Shows aggregate system throughput over time. Useful for capacity planning, workload analysis, and tracking overall system performance trends.

panels.title: GPU Kernel Dispatch Rate
panels.description:
Rate of GPU kernel dispatches per second.

Shows the frequency of GPU kernel launches (decode operations) over time. Higher rates indicate more active GPU computation. This metric tracks the llama_decode() kernel dispatches, providing insight into GPU workload intensity and generation activity.
